title: Simple If Statement
description: This example demonstrates a basic if statement in Java. A predefined variable is checked to see if it is positive, and a message is printed accordingly.

title: If-Else Statement
description: The if-else statement executes a block of code if a specified condition is true. Otherwise, it executes the else block.

title: Nested If Statement
description: Nested if statements allow multiple conditions to be checked within another if block.

title: Else-If Ladder
description: Else-if statements allow multiple conditions to be checked sequentially.

title: Switch Case Statement
description: The switch statement allows executing different blocks of code based on different cases.

title: Check if a Number is Positive
description: This program checks if a predefined integer is positive using an if statement.

title: Determine if a Number is Even or Odd
description: This program checks whether a predefined number is even or odd using the modulus operator inside an if-else statement.

title: Find the Largest of Two Numbers
description: This program determines the largest of two predefined numbers using if-else conditions.

title: Check if a Number is Negative
description: This program checks if a predefined integer is negative using an if statement.

title: Check if a Number is Zero
description: This program checks if a predefined number is zero using an if condition.

title: Check if a Person is Eligible to Vote
description: This program checks if a person's age meets the voting age requirement using an if-else statement.

title: Check if a Number is Positive, Negative, or Zero
description: This program classifies a predefined integer as positive, negative, or zero using an if-else ladder.

title: Determine if a Number is a Multiple of 5
description: This program checks whether a predefined number is a multiple of 5 using an if condition.
